organizations: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Incorporated
locations: One Bryant Park, 5th Floor, New York, NY 10036

relationships.description: Colleagues or business associates; Amanda is providing tax information to Richard
Richard is forwarding tax information to Jeffrey

analysis.purpose: To forward tax planning information regarding anticipated changes under the Trump administration
analysis.significance: Shows financial planning communications during political transition period

notable_quotes: The election of Donald Trump as President is expected to lead to significant tax law changes.
The tax changes may come in two parts: from the repeal of the Affordable Care Act (ObamaCare) and its related taxes and from comprehensive tax reform.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present; routine professional communication

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed; routine tax planning communication

public_knowledge.context: Tax policy changes following presidential elections are routine public knowledge and widely discussed in financial media

analysis.summary: Richard Kahn forwards a tax advisory email from Amanda Ens at Bank of America Merrill Lynch discussing anticipated tax law changes following Donald Trump's election, including potential repeal of Affordable Care Act taxes and comprehensive tax reform.
